ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Potters] Digest Number 87
ygData.msgSnippet: A couple questions here. I have made both Resisting and Protection Deities but I find I cannot ready either.  I am a druid and should be able to ready at
ygData.messageBody:
A couple questions here. I have made both "Resisting" and "Protection"
Deities but I find I cannot ready either. I am a druid and should be able
to ready at least the "Protection" Deity. Also what is the use for lined
vials? I know rogues use the regular ones for poison and enchanters use
them for Viscous Mana.

Chrysiana
Druid and Master Potter on Cazic Thule


>^_^ I am a cleric. I took up pottery before Verant
>meddled with the pie tins and made it a loss making
>matter.

>But now I can make vials, and sell them cheap, like
>2pp per poison vial, and 3pp per lined vial. I think I
>have been staying in Unrest for 6 months straight,
>which practically gives me the advantage of killing
>pestering tormented dead like nobody's business.

>And I'd say I have a new incentive for taking pottery.
>Making protection deities and laying blessings on
>friends and lovers (I am a priestess of the Phoenix
>and conduct wedding ceremonies). So pottery isn't all
>that bad. It really depends on whether you have a
>vivid imagination. ^_^

>Annabelle Prettily
>Priestess of the Phoenix
>Phoenix Dragoons

> From what I've found there no market selling pottery
> items to any of the
> three people above, as anyone can become a master
> potter for an outlay of
> only 20pp. Hopefully they'll expand it a little so
> that there is a point to
> some pottery items besides being used for other
> trade skills - if you could
> make something that people would actually use,
> rather than something they
> just use as a component to make something else, then
> there would be a
> market for it. I'd like to see 10 slot clay jars, so
> we could finally stop
> those tailors gouging the market for 100-150pp a
> backpack :)
